pdqninja.pdqio
Interface Splitter

All Known Implementing Classes:
DelimitedSplitter, FixedSizeSplitter
public interface Splitter

An object that can split a file into chunks. This object is responsible for locating the begin and end of each split within a given file.

The PDQ library uses the Splitter object in the following way:

  • the RandomAccessFile will be positioned at a location which is the starting point for locating the next split.
  • the library will call splitBegin(RandomAccessFile) to request the file offset where the next split begins. The Splitter object can return -1 to indicate that there are no more splits available
  • if the returned value is -1, the library will not ask for any more splits
  • if the returned value is non-negative, the RandomAccessFile will be positioned at that offset, and the library will call the splitEnd(RandomAccessFile, long) to request the end of the split. The library provides blocksize as a hint on the expected size of the split. The object must return a valid file offset.

    • The same splitter object can be asked to split more than one file. It is recommended that the Splitter objects do not cache any file specific information.

    Method Summary
     long splitBegin(RandomAccessFile raf)
              Locate the file offset where the next split begins, or -1 if there are no more splits.
     long splitEnd(RandomAccessFile raf, long blocksize)
              Locate the file offset where the next split ends.
     

    Method Detail

    splitBegin

    long splitBegin(RandomAccessFile raf)
                throws IOException
    Locate the file offset where the next split begins, or -1 if there are no more splits.

    The RandomAccessFile will already be positioned at a location after which the next split is requested.

    Parameters:
    raf - the file for which the beginning offset of the next split is request
    Returns:
    file offset where the next split begins, or -1 if there are no more splits
    Throws:
    IOException

    splitEnd

    long splitEnd(RandomAccessFile raf,
              long blocksize)
              throws IOException
    Locate the file offset where the next split ends.

    The RandomAccessFile will be positioned at the offset returned by the previous call to splitBegin(RandomAccessFile). This method must return a valid file offset.

    Parameters:
    raf - the file for which the end offset of the next split is request
    blocksize - hint on the expected size of the split
    Returns:
    file offset where the next split ends
    Throws:
    IOException
